title: prompted for passwords to accounts that don't have 'check for messages' turned on
content: Why am I being prompted repetitively for passwords to accounts that I don't have 'check for messages' turned on? Prior to the most recent update 115 (currently 115.6.1 (32-bit)) accounts that I check infrequently would not popup a password prompt. Now they will not stop popping up.
creator: gotchawk1

title: Can't connect to server
content: Why can't I connect to your server? I haven't been able to get my emails for two days.
creator: rfmckay

title: How do you bulk delete emails from Thunderbird inbox
content: How do you delete bulk emails in the inbox of Thunderbird email system. There are thousands and most are old.
creator: lindajoymyers

title: Identities limit
content: I have 60+ mailboxes as I manage a lot of domains. The problem is that if I add a new mailbox it seems to work fine downloading messages but the outgoing smtp settings overwrite a previous one. The limit seems to be 48 I'm on TB ver 115.6.0 (64-bit) on Linux Mint 21.2 Cinnamon. Looking through prefs.js the highest number in the smtp server list is 49. Is it a bug or is there some setting that limits new identities?
creator: thunderbird23

title: The option to list emails by sender is grayed ouot
content: Without original column headers which you could toggle to sort ascending or descending has the "SENDER" column grayed out - Cannot sort the list by Senders Name because the option under the pulldown menu "View" shows the FROM field grayed out - inoperable - Previous versions allowed all columns to be ascending or descending - in this version of tbird most of the common columns are grayed out
creator: circutronics

title: link was deactivated to give you time to check domain
content:
Hi, I detest the new TB feature to automatically deactivate all links in an incoming mail... while this feature might be helpful to some people, I would like to switch it off and do my own due diligence if I click a link or not, but within ms, not until TB allows me to click...I find no way of switching off this newly introduced feature... any idea? thx

Dan
creator: Dan70
